intro: Impatiens kinabaluensis, commonly known as the Kinabalu Impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Mount Kinabalu in Borneo. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and white. The plant is an upright herb with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to the unique microclimate of its mountainous habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
